description: From Middle English ensuren, from Anglo-Norman enseurer, from Old French seur (“sure”).

verbs.description: ensure (third-person singular simple present ensures, present participle ensuring, simple past and past participle ensured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make a pledge to (someone); to promise, guarantee (someone of something); to assure. [14th–18th c.]
(intransitive) To make sure or certain of something (usually some future event or condition). [from 18th c.]
examples: I use an alarm clock to ensure that I get up on time.
